conclusion: Understanding principles based on Boyle's Law and displacement method
Device consists of containers C and D connected by a U-tube B
Container C has initial volume V_C and is under atmospheric pressure P_0
Container D is under atmospheric pressure P_0 and its volume is V_D
Solid placed in container C displaces air equal to its volume V_solid
New volume of air in container C is V_C - V_solid
System reaches new equilibrium with adjusted pressures
Using Boyle’s Law: P_0 * V_C = P * (V_C - V_solid)
Using Boyle’s Law for container D: P_0 * V_D = P * V_D
Equating pressures: P = (P_0 * V_C) / (V_C - V_solid) = (P_0 * V_D) / V_D
Further simplification leads to: V_C - V_solid = V_D
